data.title: F-yeah! Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated
data.meta_description: A celebration of the greatest entry in the "Scooby-Doo Universe"
data.text:
Brief Synopsis:

Two gigantic Monsters are terrorizing Crystal Cove, can the gang stop them before the town is ruined?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

The Humungonauts

Episode Review:

We open at the new nightclub/hot spot in Crystal Cove, The Tiki Tub.

Trini Lee, the local talent is singing a pretty dreadful song, The Words Got Stuck in My Throat.

Sheriff Stone is congratulating Mayor Dad on his genius idea. Mayor Dad says its just another check mark on his list. Mayor Dad congratulates Sheriff Stone on how quiet things have been around town lately.

Suddenly, a gigantic green ape breaks into the Tiki Tub and destroys the place.

Mayor Dad and Sheriff Stone survive, fortunately.

The next morning, Scooby-Doo is searching for Shaggy. Given the state of Shaggys room, this might be a challenge. A radio DJ is talking about Max Minners insurance company.

Scooby-Doo wanders out to the garden and hears Shaggy saying something from behind the bushes. He decides Shaggy is in danger and rushes to his rescue

only to discover its Shaggy and Velma making out.

Shaggy tries to explain that he and Velma were having a staring contest. Velma is not happy with this. Scooby-Doo is even more unhappy and accuses Shaggy of cheating on him. Cause thats not all kinds of weird.

Shaggy says its silly, because Scooby-Doo is his dogand he cares for both of them in different ways. He then tries to tell Scooby-Doo that he is dating Velma. Scooby-Doo reacts badly.

He is still reacting badly on the way to the Tiki Tub. Fred tries to blame himself, but Velma sets the record straight. Shaggy tries to play Diplomat and fails.

They arrive at the wrecked Tiki Tub. Theres an awkward moment of silence where no one wants to leave.

And then they start investigating.

Sheriff Stone arrives on the scene. He tries to ward the gang off.

A local building contractor, Rusty Gnales is pretty pleased with the damage, since it means his business is booming.

The kids ask the Sheriff if he has any idea what the monster is. He says its some new and unidentified monster that he has started calling a humungonaut. He says hes grateful theres only onebecause can you imagine if there were two?

And, right on cue, out pops a red one.

Back at KGhoul, Angel Dynamite is playing The Words Get Stuck In My Throat because why not? We hear another advertisement for insurance, this time for Jax.

Angel Dynamite walks into the lobby to find the kids moping and wants to know whats up.

Velma says that the group is down because of emotional drama, and that until they clear the air nothing will happen. Daphne suggests a pow wow, where someone mediates a discussion, like they do when her mother sleeps in the backyard treehouse.

Velma asks Angel to help, however she declines. She states she is only good at two things: spinning records and being a stone-cold fox. Fred says he knows just the person.

The gang reconvenes at Freds house.where the mediator arrives

and its Sheriff stone. With a smoker.

He is disappointed that he will not be cooking for a barbecue, and tells Fred that if he wasnt Mayor Dads son, he would make him disappear.

He does wind up making food, while simultaneously not helping the gang.

Velma looses her cool. She says that all of the issues they are having are because Shaggy wont man up. She and Scooby-Doo issue an ulitimatum to Shaggy. Its either her or him.

Fred interrupts with an idea. He thinks the team needs an identity, and he wants to use the name of the original Mystery Incorporated

he also wants them to wear uniforms. Because of course.

They arrive at the wreckage from that morning. Gnales Construction is doing great business there as well. Daphne is suspicious.

That night they arrive at Gnales Construction. Signs are all over for Max and Jax Minner. They apparently have separate insurance companies.

They sneak around the place, looking for clues. Shaggy and Scooby-Doo keep bumping into each other and the tension remains high between them.

Suddenly, the Green Humungonaut appears. He starts smashing stuff up.

It manages to explode a propane tank, destroying the property completely. Fortunately for Mr. Gnales, hes present for the destruction. Unfortunately, his place is destroyed.

As Mystery Inc. is driving back from their adventures, theres another radio ad for insurance. Suddenly, the signal is jammed and Mr. E interrupts.

He has another riddle for them. He tells them To solve the mystery, do as follows: Open your eyes and look for the signs that are all around you. Open your ears and youll add to your knowledge. Open your minds and youll ensure a speedy solution.

The signal un-jams and we hear a different radio ad.

The next day at City Hall, Fred attempts to talk to Mayor Dad about the situation. Mayor Dad agrees that they are dangerous

and what better way to solve the problem than to let them do a Battle Royale at the local arena!

The plan is for the Humungonauts to come to the arena filled with valuable loot and sell tickets for the destruction. Sort of like a monster truck rally. Mayor Dad is hopeful his Trap will work. This, understandably, upsets Fred because his Dad is building a trap without him. The gang storms out.

That night at the arena, the main trap is set and both Mystery Inc. and the Sheriff and his posse are waiting.

As Fred scopes the trap situation out, Velma discovers something. Using her laptop, shes discovered that all the attacks have been focused on specific buildings with no overtly obvious connection to each other.

Shaggy says that it sounds as confusing as one of Mr. Es clueswhich kicks Velma into gear.

The scene shifts to an old, abandoned dock. Velma says she believes this will be the next site of a Humungonaut attack.

The creatures appear and start battling each other. Its epic. Lots of destruction.

Eventually, they catch them in a net. Velma is surprised that one of the traps actually worked.

Mayor Dad is equally surprised.

Sheriff Stone promptly welcomes the supposed space travelersuntil Velma reveals that they are none other than.

Jax and Max Minner. The insurance guys from the radio. They were former carnival wrestlers who went into insurance. They hated each other and wanted to ruin each others business. They would have worked if it werent for their meddling brothers.

Daphne says that they seem to be doing ok again. Fred reminds them that its teamwork that makes a team. Not the other stuff. Velma questions the uniforms, and Fred says they dont have to wear them but-

They immediately remove them before he can finish his thought.

The mystery is solved, but Velma and Scooby-Doo demand an answer to their ultimatum from before. Shaggy, reluctant to choose, screams something about a blue Humungonaut

and runs away screaming. Leaving behind an unhappy Velma and Scooby-Doo.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

1) The Name. This episode marks the official beginnings of the new Mystery Incorporated, or Mystery Inc.

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

Buckets of Bear Bait

Prancing Piccolos

My Thoughts:

This is one of my favorite episodes for a couple of reasons.

The first being the song. Its an awful, awful song and I love every deliciously awful second of it. If I had a way to make that my ringtone, I would do it and not think twice about it.

The second is the entire opening sequence is almost a direct copy of the original film, albeit shortened.

Heres the film:

Heres the show:

Another thing I like about this episode is how much they focus on the characters.

Like an idiot, I forgot that while Scooby-Doo has sort of forgiven Shaggy, the tension is still there. And this is clearly front and center of this episode.

One of the creepier aspects of this series is the weird relationship between Shaggy and Scooby-Doo. Granted, this will become juxtaposition for the main bad guy (who has yet to be officially introduced) and his human, but as of nowits creepy.

That being said, I think its a very interesting storyline to take. Whenever a couple first gets together, the relationship affects others around them, both directly and indirectly, particularly both partys best friend. In this case, that best friend happens to be a dog.

Unfortunately, unlike most best friends/significant others, they have decided to force Shaggy into an ultimatum, one that is going to get someone, if not all of them, hurt.

In retrospect, one of the other things I like about this episode is that its the last one before the Curse really begins to become the focus. In some ways, this is the The Prisoner of Azkaban of the series. There is the emotional strife between Velma/Shaggy/Scooby-Doo, but overall the characters are happy and blissfully unaware of what is about to happen.

From Episode 10 on, the series starts to take an even darker tone. The danger starts heightening, the main villain is introduced, and their lives as they know it, are over.

Pop-Culture References:

This entire episode is a parody/homage to War of the Gargantuas, a classic Toho monster film. The song The Words Get Stuck in My Throat and its entire staging are ripped directly from the movie, including Fran Southworths vocals.

The design of the Humungonauts sort of resemble Red and Green Hulk.

Main Cast:

Norville Shaggy Rogers  Matthew Lillard

Scoobert Scooby Doo  Frank Welker

Frederick Fred Jones, Jr.  Frank Welker

Daphne Blake  Grey DeLisle

Velma Dinkley  Mindy Cohn

Featured Recurring Characters:

Sheriff Bronson Stone  Patrick Warburton

Mayor Dad  Gary Cole

Notable Guest Stars:

Trini Lee  Fran Southworth (uncredited)

Max and Jax Minner  Tom Kenney

Rusty Gnales  Fred Tatascoire

Brief Synopsis:

An evil gnome is terrorizing people dressed as pirates at the local renaissance faire. When Shaggy is kidnapped, can the gang rescue him before its too late?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

The Gnome

Episode Review:

We are at the Crystal Cove Royal Knights Faire. A guy dressed as a pirate approaches his girlfriend who scoffs at his costume.

She doesnt understand why someone would dress like a pirate at a fair for knights. He tells her pirates are way cooler.

He leaves her momentarily to adjust his waist sashonly to be attacked by an evil Gnome.

His girlfriend finds him all weird and blue and frozen.

Lord Barry is welcoming people to the fair, although he is clearly unhappy by people dressed as pirates.

The Court Jester disagrees with Barry and tells Queen Amanda his feelings. If there are more people, there is more money. She insists on historical accuracy, because without it, who knows what lowlives will arrive

like Shaggy and Scooby-Doo dressed and talking like pirates.

Velma asks if she can join Shaggy, and he seems mostly finebut he does tell her she needs to dress like a wench and speak like a pirate.

As Velma states that she wont put on those dumb clothes, Fred and Daphne show up in more accurate costumes.

Fred wants to explore the Black Plague Village with its traps, and Daphne is more interested in showing off her oddly ugly outfit.

Velma points out that they are taking the guy away on a stretcher.

His girlfriend is trying to explain to Sheriff Stone and Mayor Dad just what happened.

Daphne asks what happens, and of course, they write it off as a standard spooking and a future business endeavor.

Skipper Shelton is trying to hawk Cotton Candy Clams just like Richard III use to eat. He then asks who is he kidding.

We return to our storyline with the girlfriend explaining to the gang what happened.

Velma says it sounds odd to her. Its more of a goblin or sprite power than a gnome power. Fred agrees and says they have to get to the bottom of it. She suggests checking with her mom, whos running the souvenir shop by the Ice Cream Moat. She invites Peg Leg Shaggy along, who in turn invites Scooby-Doo.

Velma then asks Is it me, or are pirates just hobos with earrings?

At the Ice Cream Moat, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo are drinking from the moatwhich seems unsanitary, but whatever.

Velma asks her Mom if something is wrong with her. Angie tells her that shes a great girl, when she isnt trying to be smarter than everyone else. Velma laments that she cares about him and wants him to care about her, too.

Angie comforts her and tells her it will happen. And if not, shell make him a special potion of poison mushrooms and wormwood. Ah, mother/daughter bonding

She then hands Velma a book called, Im Okay, Youre a Scary Gnome. She warns her daughter that if it is a Scary Gnome, to be careful as they hold grudges.

That night, two guys dressed as pirates leave the fair and are attacked by the gnome and left paralyzed.

The paramedics come and take the two boys away.

The Jester states that the attacks could hurt business. The Queen isnt worried.

Fred asks Mayor Dad what he thinks of the situation. His dad agrees that it needs investigatingbut to find out what tricks it can do for marketing plans.

Meanwhile, as the boys are being taken to the hospital, Daphne notices a purple jeweled earring in one of their hands.

Velma reveals that while there are all sorts of Gnomes, none seem to particularly have a beef with pirates.

The Gnome continues his attacks on pirates, forcing the town to turn the local theatre into an emergency station.

Fred, Daphne and Velma investigate the paralyzed victims.

While Fred is taking a strange device to the paralyzed victims, Daphne asks Velma if everything is ok. Velma confides in Daphne how she feels.

Fred returns and asks whats going on. Daphne explains and Fred tells Velma she should relax. He goes on to state that since they all have a great relationship together, why spoil it by having a separate one?

Oh, and hes found a possible clue.

Back in the Mystery Machine, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo are eating snacks, while Velma uncovers what the strange goo was. A jellyfish toxin that causes temporary paralysis. Temporary, but long enough for the fair to be over.

Back at the fair, Scooby-Doo and Shaggy have decided to investigate the food.

They overhear Lord Barry and the Jester discussing the pirates. Lord Barry hates them and says they never showed up when he was running things. The Jester reminds him that when he was in charge he nearly ran things into the ground. Lord Barry reminds him that he only got in charge because he married Queen Amanda.

After Lord Barry enters the castle, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo sneak around and peek in a window and discover that Lord Barry secretly dresses like a pirate.

Suddenly, the Gnome appears and proceeds to chase them!

Shaggy tells Scooby-Doo to find the others and save himself, before knocking himself unconscious.

The Gnome has him captured.

The gang are sitting at a picnic table. Scooby-Doo wont eat. Velma is coddling Shaggys faux parrot.

Suddenly, Scooby-Doo gets angry at Velma and tries to take the parrot away from her.

The fight is interrupted by a phone call from Mr. E. Velma demands answers. He tells them to begin their search at the end, and to enjoy the rest of the fair.

Scooby-Doo leads them back to the forest where he and Shaggy were separated.

True to form, while searching the area, Danger Prone Daphne discovers a hollow tree.

They discover an overly elaborate series of walkways above the fairgrounds. They realize that this is how the Gnome has been getting around, and decide to set a trap.

The Gnome catches wise, and before he can be caught, escapes to the trees.

As Fred, Daphne and Velma chase after the Gnome, Scooby-Doo finds and frees Shaggy.

After much chasing and confusion, the Gnome is caught

and revealed to be The Jester, Gil Littlefoot. He wanted to frame Queen Amanda so that he could take her fortune for his own. And he would have gotten away with it, if it werent for you meddling gnome hating, pirate loving kids.

Once again, Mayor Dad is disappointed that the Gnome isnt a real Gnome.

Fred decides to celebrate by throwing alms at the poor, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo head off for more Cotton Candy Clams, and Daphne and Velma wish each other luck with their respective men.

A strange hooded figure bumps into Velma

and drops a box from Mr. E on the ground.

Inside the box is a note from Mr. E telling Velma Dont give up. It has all happened before. There is also a photograph of the original Mystery Incorporated with a parrotwhos picture is circled.

Velma is left wondering what exactly is going on.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

1) Professor Pericles. The first appearance of a very very pivotal character.

2) The Letter. Mr. Es letter to Velma reiterates the fact that this is somehow cyclical.

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

Poseys and Pinwheels

My Thoughts:

In general, this is kind of a throwaway episode.

Yes, you get some character development with Angie and Velma, and to a degree with Velma and Shaggy. But honestly, no new ground is covered here.

If anything, this episode is reminding us off everything thats happened, and of most characters motives.

Of course, Skipper Sheltons random appearance is welcome and hilarious.

The most important aspect of the episode is the very end. The introduction of Pericles (although yet unnamed) is an important one, as he becomes a major player in the rest of the series.

I will say that I have been greatly looking forward to reviewing the next episode, so we now just wait for next week!

Pop-Culture References:

Several of the fair goers are dressed similar to Dirk from the classic Dragons Lair game.

Two of the paramedics looks similar to Randolph Mantooth and Kevin Tighe from the classic 1970s drama Emergency.

Angie Dinkleys book, Im Okay, Youre a Scary Gnome is a parody on the self-help book, Im Okay, Youre Okay.

Im sure there are some allusions to Leprechaun in this episode, however, having never seen it, I cant say for certain.

Main Cast:

Norville Shaggy Rogers  Matthew Lillard

Scoobert Scooby Doo  Frank Welker

Frederick Fred Jones, Jr.  Frank Welker

Daphne Blake  Grey DeLisle

Velma Dinkley  Mindy Cohn

Featured Recurring Characters:

Sheriff Bronson Stone  Patrick Warburton

Mayor Dad  Gary Cole

Angie Dinkley  Frances Conroy

Mr. E  Lewis Black

Skipper Shelton  John OHurley

Notable Guest Stars:

Lord Barry  Lloyd Sherr

Gil Littlefoot  Jeffrey Tambor

Queen Amanda  Audrey Wasileweski

The Gnome  Frank Welker

Brief Synopsis:

A phantom is stalking The Hex Girls. Can the gang solve the mystery?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

The Phantom

Episode Review:

The gang are at the Terrorpherum Theatre seeing The Hex Girls in Concert.

Daphne marvels at the fact they have front row seats. Fred says its thanks to Velma being their biggest fan

which cuts to Velma fan-girling and flailing like theres no tomorrow.

Shaggy is videotaping the concert, but Scooby-Doo keeps getting in the shot. When Shaggy asks him to move, Scooby-Doo gets snippy. Shaggy says its because hes still upset that he ditched the Van Ghoul marathon for Prom.

Suddenly, there is a flickering of light and an explosion, revealing onstage a mysterious Phantom.

He warns The Hex Girls that this will be their last concert. Thorn takes a stand and tells him to buzz off. Angered, The Phantom shoots electric balls into one of the onstage speakers, knocking it over on Thorn and then disappearing in another explosion.

Backstage, Thorn is nursing her head. Their songwriter, Daniel, wants them to just cancel the tourbut neither the Hex Girls or their manager, Gus Boggs, have any interest in doing so.

The gang are also in agreement. Fred suggests the idea of using a double for Thorn, since she seems to be the primary target for the Phantom. Velma quickly flips her lid and tries to get the part.

Fred recommends Daphne, instead.

She immediately sings a little acapella, and Thorn agrees with the idea.

Daphne is pretty stoked, until she realizes shes going to be bait.

That night, Daphne goes on for Thorn. Shes understandably nervous about going on, although wether its the Phantom or the Fans, shes not sure.

Daphne goes onstage and launches into Earth, Wind, Fire and Air.

Suddenly, The Phantom appears. They spring the trap, but it backfires, capturing Dusk and Luna by mistake.

The Phantom disappears with Daphne.

Sheriff Stone arrives and is oddly concerned with the price of t-shirts and if they are made from cottonthe kind that comes from cows. I frequently worry about him.

Velma explains what happened to Stone. He seems to sort of understand, but is confused by Freds behavior.

Fred confesses he is feeling all sorts of emotions that he doesnt understand.

Thorn asks Stone what the next step is. He babbles off some oddly specific town ordinance and states that all hes going to do is take some merch and call the Mayor.

Velma declares that it is up to them to solve this mystery.

Shaggy and Scooby-Doo are investigating in the lobby. Scooby-Doo still wont speak to Shaggy, and goes so far as to suggest that they might need to find new best friends.

Fred is investigating the catwalks above the stage, and discovers that the trap had been sabotaged, and that the mishap wasnt his fault.

Fred is relieved that it wasnt his fault, however he still feels conflicted. He walks away to rejoin the gang, revealing Daphnehanging behind him by a rope with a gag in her mouthbut then the rope snaps. Fred realizes that he cares about Daphne as he returns to the gang with is newsonly to discover his Dad is there.

Mayor Dad wants Fred to lay off on the Phantom as the next day is Phantom Day and its good for business. Fred tries to tell everyone about the trap when Daphne reappears.

Daphne is angry, having only heard the first part of Freds monologue and wont allow him to explain.

Daniel, the songwriter, decides that this is proof that the whole affair is too dangerous and that they should cancel the whole thing.

Daphne, still outraged, declares that she will go on tomorrow night and she will rock!

As Daphne, the Hex Girls, Mayor Dad and Gus Boggs leave, Velma wonders aloud if things can get any weirder

they can. Scooby-Doo has picked up Harry, Shaggys old ventriloquist dummy and declared it his new best friend. Harry, according to Scooby-Doo, loves food and would never leave him for a girl. Velma sighs and says Hes your dog and Fred offers him a simple Sorry, I have my own problems.

In Velmas bedroom, Daphne tells the Hex Girls to make her a rock star. They do.

Velma asks if they will do the same to her. They do not.

Next, we find Fred walking down a dark street. He reminisces about Daphne and he together.

Suddenly, he shouts out that he has feelings for traps and for Daphne and that he isnt a guy. He runs to find her.

He arrives at Velmas house and bursts into the room demanding to speak to Daphne.

She tells him that Daphne is no more, and turns around to reveal her new identity, Crush.

Fred attempts to explain himsef, badly. He implores Daphne to not go on tomorrow, and she dismisses him. She has the Hex Girls kick him out.

Velma asks her if shes ok, as shes never stood up for herself in front of Fred before. Daphne says she really isnt.

In the Hex Girls tour van, Scooby-Doo and Harry are watching a Vincent Van Ghoul movie. Shaggy is officially pissed off and calls Scooby-Doo out on it

and then Shaggy proceeds to argue with Harry about the situation.

Shaggy gets angry at Harry and starts to wrestle with him (with Scooby-Doo cheering for Harry), before realizing what hes doing. He throws Harry aside causing its head to pop off

and roll into The Phantom!!!!

The Phantom proceeds to do a classic Scooby-Doo Door Chase Sequence.

When he fails to catch them, he sets the trailer on fireforcing Shaggy to throw Harry through the window to save them.

He and Scooby-Doo barely make it out before the trailer explodes. Scooby-Doo, of course, thanks Harry for saving them.

Shaggy notices that part of the Phantoms costume is in Harrys mouthand realizes that he has seen that fabric before

in a music video for a One-Hit Wonder named Fantzee Pantz, who had the same manager as the Hex Girls, Gus Boggs.

They confront Boggs about the video.

He tells them that Fantzee Pantz went Down the rabbit hole after the record label dumped him in favor of the Hex Girls.

Shaggy is at a loss on what to do. Scooby-Doo states that Harry will be the answer. Shaggy is about to explode when Fred has an idea

We cut to the rehearsal for the concert. Daphne, as Crush, has joined the girls onstage.

Daphne is having trouble adjusting. Thorn tells her its ok, that shes been there before, with a carney named Knuckles. She tells Daphne she got over it by writing a song, and suggests writing one together.

Finally, its time for the concert.

Daphne makes her big debut singing her song Trap of Love.

Velma asks Fred what he thinks, and its clear hes not happy.

Daphne finishes the song to rapturous applause. The curtain desceneds.

From above The Phantom begins his final strike.

He swings down and grabs at what he thinks is Daphne, but turns out to be Harry. The trap is sprung and The Phantom is caught

and revealed to be Daniel, aka Fantzee Pantz. He was bitter about having been ousted by the Hex Girls. And he claims, he would have gotten away with it, if it werent for the uncanny boy band knowledge of the meddling brats.

After the show, Fred tells Daphne that he liked her song, and that if she wants to be free, he wont stop her. He also tells her how he really feels. Daphne says shes staying.

Shaggy apologizes to Scooby-Doo about the loss of Harry. Apparently, Harry was stuck to Fantzee Pantz and was taken to jail with him. Scooby-Doo says that the only dummy he needs is Shaggy. The two reconcile.

Everyone seems happyexcept for poor Velma. The episode closes with her looking forlorn.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

None

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

Bug Eyed Biscuits

My Thoughts:

First off, The Hex Girls rock. Hard core. Id go to a live concert if I could.

This is one of the better episodes that doesnt involve The Curse. The writing is sharp and the suspense, while never on the same level as The Creeping Creatures is fun.

The episode takes great steps with development in this episode. Primarily between Fred and Daphne, but Shaggy and Scooby-Doo get their due as well.

Ill touch on Shaggy and Scooby-Doo first, as Daphne and Fred segue better into my next thought. While, thankfully, they dont drag out the Scooby-Doo jealousy bit, they do at least extend it through the episode. Its nice because, by and large, Scooby-Doo doesnt have (or need) much development. He is Shaggys best friend. This subplot serves the purpose of reminding us (the viewer) that even the things we consider to be constant, sometimes need the proper respect and attention they deserve.

Had Shaggy just told Scooby-Doo what was happening, he would have saved a lot of hurt. However, because he tried to do the classic two places at once bit, he caused more trouble than he should have.

They give a comical juxtaposition to the bigger subplot of Fred and Daphne.

Weve known since Episode 1 that Daphne had a thing for Fred. Over the course of the last episode or two, Fred seems to pick up on this. However, when Daphne is kidnapped and it seems that it was his fault, he really has to deal with these feelings.

His reaction to it is rather human. He fears that by having these feelings, it somehow makes him less of a guy. This isnt all together weird, given that in the culture Fred lives in, as well as the culture many of us in America live in, frowns upon guys having or expressing emotions openly.

This is one of the few times the writers really touch on the ideas of gender constructs in the series. Theyll get into some other interesting areas, including the idea of ends justifying the means later, but this is the main foray into this concept.

You have a main character in a major series questioning what it means to be a guy. He ultimately decides that his feelings for Daphne are more important to him, and that expressing them to her is more important than what he perceives to be social acceptable. Its a somewhat subtle motion on their part, but it really can have a far-reaching effect if the series finds a niche in syndication. And, if it doesnt, at least it sets a precedent that it can be done for future cartoon series.

Another thing the writers of this episode did was create a character that is, while unspoken, clearly homosexual. Gus Boggs, the manager, openly calls Mayor Dad handsome (which is true), mentions his own eye shadow, and flips his wrist and swishes his way through most of the episode.

Yes, its a borderline offensive stereotype (we get worse in another episode), but its a pretty major step. Sure there have been implied gay characters in childrens cartoons, most of the cast of SpongeBob Square Pants, for instance. There have also been characters in cartoons that have been adopted by the GLBT culture as symbols, including Velma herself. But this is the first time weve had someone who was clearly gay in a cartoon. Again, kids probably didnt pick up on it, but it still lays ground work for the future.

The songs sung by The Hex Girls are mostly recycled from their appearance in Scooby-Doo and The Witchs Ghost. Personally, I love both of the songs, and may or may not own the soundtrack to the film for those songs. However, the new song Trap of Love is kind of sub-par in comparison. Yes, it was plot based but it really wasnt that great a song and it went on a little too long.

Next episode we return to the overall mystery and a very very important character is finally introduced.

Pop-Culture References:

The Hex Girls are recurring characters in the Scooby-verse. They made their first appearance in Scooby-Doo and the Witchs Ghost.

While the overall plot line comes from Gaston Lerouxs The Phantom of the Opera, The Phantoms costume and backstory is more similar to that of Winslow Leachs in The Phantom of the Paradise.

Main Cast:

Norville Shaggy Rogers  Matthew Lillard

Scoobert Scooby Doo  Frank Welker

Frederick Fred Jones, Jr.  Frank Welker

Daphne Blake  Grey DeLisle

Velma Dinkley  Mindy Cohn

Featured Recurring Characters:

Sheriff Bronson Stone  Patrick Warburton

Mayor Dad  Gary Cole

Thorn  Jennifer Hale

Luna  Kimberly Brooks

Dusk  Jane Weidlin

Vincent Van Ghoul  Maurice LaMarche

Notable Guest Stars:

The Phantom  Fred Tatasciore

Daniel Prezette/Fantzee Pantz  Quinton Flynn

Brief Synopsis:

A mysterious ghost girl is kidnapping boys who take her to prom, when she sets her eyes on Fred, will the gang be able to save him?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

Alice May

Episode Review:

A black limo drives up to a house in the suburbs.

Out of the house walks Randy, dressed in a classy powder blue tux. His mother and father follow him out taking pictures. His mother waxes nostalgic for her prom. His father reminds her they didnt go to prom together. Randy rushes out to the car to avoid a really awkward moment.

He gets in next to a very pretty girl, who confesses this isnt her first prom. She tells him that her others schools she went with other boys.

She then rips off her face and asks him to be her boyfriend for forever..and everand everand ever

The scene shifts and were at Shaggys house, catching the tail end of a Vincent Van Ghoul movie. Theyre excited because the following week is the annual Vincent Van Ghoul Movie Marathon.

Velma is less than thrilled about the Marathon, because this year its on their one month anniversary and prom.

However, she has devised a way to make it work out. Theyll come out as a couple on Prom Night and then watch the martahon togetheralone.

The next day at school, Fred and Daphne are discussing the upcoming prom. Daphne is dropping MAJOR hints that she wants Fred to take her. Fred is oblivious.

They arrive at Freds locker to discover a girl a few lockers down is having trouble getting hers to open. Fred, ever the hero, gets it open.

She introduces herself as Alice May. Daphne immediately hates her.

The scene shifts to the auditorium where an assembly is about to begin. Velma reminds Shaggy to call the limo company. Daphne asks where Fred isjust in time for Fred to walk up with Alice May.

While Daphne simmers, Sheriff Stone begins his presentation. He wants to inform the kids of The Dangers of Prom. This year it isnt what youd expector maybe you would since its Crystal Cove and clearly on top of a Hellmouth. This year, the Dangers are a Ghost Girl. Who kidnaps boys. In her car.

After the assembly Fred offers Alice May a ride home, but she declines as she prefers to walk. He then offers one to Daphne who flips out on him, stating that shed rather go investigate the missing kids that Mr. E wanted them to investigate rather than being *clueless*.

That night at the school, Daphne is doing research.

She discovers maps, articles and old books that have pieces missingall of it having to do with the missing kids.

Suddenly the power goes out in the library. She notices a figure running trhough the stacks and gives chase.

Said figure tips a bookcase over, trying to crush Daphne.

Daphne escapes and follows the figure into the girls locker room

where she discovers Alice May. Alice May claims she is there because they havent turned the water on in her new house, and she needed to use the shower.

Daphne excuses herself, but lags behind and spies on Alice May, who randomly enters the schools basement.

The next morning at K-Ghoul, Daphne fills the gang in on the night before.

Fred thinks shes overreacting about Alice May, because of course. Daphne suspects that Alice May is The Ghost Girl, which Fred also tries to laugh off stating that hed notice if she were the Ghost Girl. Both Velma and Scooby-Doo agree that he probably wouldnt. Daphne confronts Fred about liking Alice May and he immediately finds a reason to disappear. So he isnt *that* clueless.

After hes left, Angel discovers something worrying. Randy was not the first boy that the Ghost Girl has grabbed, shes in fact grabbed boys dating back to the turn of the century (Which century is unclear). Angel suggests that shes building a Man Posse.

That night the gang, sans Fred, go to visit Alice May. Daphne conveniently got Alice Mays address out of her locker.

But the address leads them to the Crystal Cove Cemetery. Daphne decides to investigate and that they should split up. She and Scooby-Doo go in one direction, leaving Velma and Shaggy to go another.

As they search, Velma starts to grill Shaggy about the Prom. He still has to get the tickets, and the limo, and the corsage, and his tux. Velma questions if he actually wants to go to the Prom.

He attempts to tell her no, but when she starts destroying the cemetery, he quickly covers and says that he does.

Meanwhile, Daphne and Scooby-Doo hear a noise in their section of the cemetery. They look behind them to see nothing, but turn back around to find

THE GHOST GIRL!

A chase ensues and ends with the gang running inside a mausoleum.

Inside the mausoleum, they discover that it belongs to the Carlswell family. The same family that Deacon Carlswell belonged toor as hes more famously known

the Creeper. Velma reminds them that Deacon is still in prison serving time for his crimes.

However, upon opening the coffin, they discover the Creeper mask, a transfer slip from Crystal Cove High, a backpack and some supplies.

Suddenly, there is a knock on the door at the mausoleum, and in walks Fred. Daphne is relieved hes safe and tells him that Alice May is the Ghost Girl.

However, Fred doesnt believe himand the rest of the gang isnt so sure.

Fred tells Daphne shes probably overreacting, since hes going with Alice May to the Prom and is afraid it will hurt the friendship. Daphne is heartbroken.

The next night Velma is dressed for Prom, in a Dress! Angie takes her picture and by the time shes taken the camera back from her face

Velma has put her turtleneck over it.

Fred is all spiffed up with an orange bow tie

and promptly gets stuck in a trap.

Scooby-Doo gets a Dagwood sandwich out of the fridge and prepares to go to the living room

while Shaggy watches from outside. Shaggy quickly stashes his tuxedo in the bushes.

And finally Daphne is sitting on her bed crying.

Her military sister, Delilah, comes in and gives her a veryoff putting and off-topic pep talk. However, Daphne comes to the realization that she has to do something

and that something is to tackle Fred outside his house and tell him the truth.

Alice May arrives and Daphne asks him to decide. And he does. He decides Daphne, because going to the Prom with a friend is way more fun than going to the Prom with a date. Daphne says that shell take what she can get.

Fred tells Alice May hes changed his mind and wants to go with Daphne. Her limo peels away from his house.

As it pulls away, she ominously states that she understands, and soon they will, too.

Meanwhile, back at Shaggy and Scooby-Doos, they are enjoying the marathon. Shaggy suddenly decides theyre out of sardines and that he has to go to the store to get them.

He sneaks out and changes in the bushes, meets Velma and then hurriedly gets in their limo.

Scooby-Doo, however, has come to find Shaggy as they had plenty of sardinesin time to see the limo pull away. Terrified that Shaggy has been taken by the Ghost Girl, he chases after them.

They arrive at the prom, but there is no parking up front, so Velma has the driver park around back. Shortly after their limo pulls away, The Ghost Girls limo pulls up. Scooby-Doo arrives in time to see her get out, and that she was the only one in the limo.

Inside, Daphne and Fred are dancing.

Daphne is detailing how this is playing out just like her dream

when suddenly Scooby-Doo arrives to tell them about the Ghost Girl.

Of course, she makes her presence known and the entire student body flees the Prom. The Ghost Girl then begins pursuing them.

The manage to slip into the basement without The Ghost Girl following them. In the basement they discover the backpack from the Carlswell Masoleum. Inside it are Alice Mays clothes and another part of the Creeper costume.

They lure Alice May back into the gym, where they trap her using the ropes from the basketball goals.

Mayor Dad and Sheriff Stone arrive in time for Fred to reveal that The Ghost Girl is indeed Alice May.

Alice May tells them that Deacon Carlswell was her father and that she vowed revenge on the kids who had her father arrested.

And she would have succeeded if it werent for her meddling schoolmates.

After they take Alice May away, Scooby-Doo refuses to talk to Shaggy. Hes hurt because he felt that Shaggy didnt want to watch the marathon.

Daphne discovers that Alice Mays backpack has been left behind. She picks it up to return it to the sheriff, when a yearbook falls out. Its an old Crystal Cove yearbook.

Inside is a picture of the missing kids. They were a mystery solving group called Mystery Incorporated. Their group consisted of Judy Reeve, Ricky Owens, Brad Chiles, Cassidy Williams and their mascot, Professor Pericles.

Shaggy makes the obvious connection between their group and the missing kids. But they all wonder why they disappeared.

Meanwhile, Alice May is sitting in jail.

Suddenly, the door opens and a man lets her out. He asks if they suspected anything and she tells them no. It will be a few days before they realize Deacon Carlswell didnt have a daughter and by then, shell be gone.

She also tells him that it took her a while to find that yearbook, and wants to know why she then handed over to them. The man tells her that she was hired by Mr. E for a job, and that job is over, and she must now leave.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

1) The Yearbook. We discover an old Crystal Cover yearbook that names the kids from the original Mystery Inc.

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

Easy Fant-ay-see

My Thoughts:

This is a great episode for a number of reasons.

First, we get some actual character development with Daphne. Shes still very Fred-crazy, most of her plot lines will be, however she starts to take on her own personality. Shes definitely more willing to take control of her life and go after what she wants. We see this not only with Fred, but with her concern about the missing kids. Her moment with her locket is kind of touching, as it seems she genuinely wants to know who they are

We also start getting more complex relationships between Shaggy and Scooby-Doo. Weve known for 6 episodes now that Shaggy is pretty devoted to Scooby-Doo, but Scooby-Doo hasnt shown all that much towards Shaggy. Not anymore. We clearly see that Scooby-Doo values Shaggy as his best friend. A relationship that is finally solidified.

I love the use of flashbacks to the classic (and arguably one of the most famous) episodes of SDWAY. For one, it gives the series a bit of a grounding in reality, and for another it allowed Mr. E to show a truly devious side for the first time. Knowing that the gang would buy that Alice May was Deacon Carlswells child, allowed him to manipulate them without their knowing. Something that continues with him.

One of the other things I really like about the episode is that its when the real mystery starts being investigated. For the most part, its been on the back burner while relationships and characters and setting have been established. Now we get into the meat of the show, and we finally start to get to the core of the series.

The next episode doesnt reveal any new clues, but does bring about the return of some of my favorite Scooby-verse characters.

Pop-Culture References:

Randy and his parents look very similar to the characters played by Topher Grace, Debra Jo Rupp and

Alice May looks very similar to Gwen Stacey from the Spider-Man series.

This episode marks the first appearance of Vincent Van Ghoul, a parody of Vincent Price first introduced in The 13 Ghosts of Scooby-Doo. However, as Vincent Price has passed away, Maurice LaMarche now voices him.

The episode alludes to the classic SDWAY episode Jeepers! Its the Creeper! with two notable changes: the first being that his name was merely Mr. Carlswell and the second being the baby chicks absence.

Two teens at the prom resemble The Impossibles in street-clothes.

Members from The Chan Clan of The Amazing Chan and the Chan Clan are seen leaving the prom.

The prom sequence is reminiscent of Carrie, however, that might also just be because anything spooky that happens at a prom is reminiscent of that film.

Brief Synopsis:

A strange creature is spookifying the towns children, can the gang solve the mystery and save the kids?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

Que Horrifico!

Episode Review:

Its a quiet night in Crystal Cove. Daphne is babysitting a boy named Arthur.

Hes currently watching an inane cartoon built around a character named Broccoli Head.

Daphne announces its time for bed and tucks Arthur in. He proclaims her to be the bestest babysitter.

She returns downstairs to her magazine when suddenly she hears a pan-flute being played. She goes to the window and sees a strange figure outside under a street lamp. Simultaneously we see Arthur being awoken by the music.

A noise upstairs causes Daphne to check on Arthur, only to discover hes been transformed into a creature. Arthur chases her through the house and out the window.

Daphne looks back at the street lamp just in time to see Que Horrifico disappear.

The next morning on the ride to school, Daphne fills the gang in on the events of the night before. Fred suggests that maybe sugar is to blame, but Daphne shoots that down.

Shaggy is glad to hear that as he loves sugar. Velma reminds him that he promised her to stop using the word like because it makes him sound ignorant.

Daphne realizes theyre near Arthurs house, so she asks Fred if they can swing by and check on him. Fred says sure, since they wont miss anything at schooleven though hes failing Civics and has to have a tutor.

They arrive to see the entire street blocked off with police tape, and parents packing up the family carswithout the kids.

Daphne rushes up to Arthurs parents and ask how he is. Arthur appears at the window and growls at them. His parents drive away.

Sheriff Stone and Mayor Dad are on the scene, and tell the gang that the rest of the kids on the street have also been mysteriously spookified.

Fred asks if there are any leads and Sheriff Stone says yes, holding up a picture of the yet-unnamed Que Horrifico. Shaggy uses the word like and gets an elbow to the kidney.

Fred eagerly decides that they have a mystery on their handsonly to find themselves handcuffed. Mayor Dad is adamant that they will not solve a mystery as this is a real monster. And there are real profits to be made. He escorts them to school in the back of a police van.

At lunch that day, Shaggy is still struggling with using the word like, so Velma gives him a rubber band to snap. She also wants him to pick out a new pair of pants from a catalog, as hes been wearing the same ones since 8th grade. Apparently, Velma wants to change his grammar and his fashion.

In the library, Daphne and Fred are hanging around waiting on Freds tutor. Shes supposed to be a brilliant senior. And well, she isbut shes also 9. With an IQ of 195. And some sort of sinus/congestion problem. Her name is Mary Anne Gleardon.

She tells them that Civics is her passion, and that she has several brilliant ideas, but that Mayor Dad thinks shes too young to be on City Council. She then drags Fred away from a relieved Daphne.

Daphne bumps into the new exchange teacher, Dr. Luis de Portillio. He introduces himself and then tells her has to leave to teach his class on South American Indigenous Mythologies (Id take that class). He drops a book on the mysterious monster, and when Daphne hands it back to him, he gets very agitated.

That night, the mysterious monster strikes again on a different block.

The next morning the gang investigates the new block.

Shaggy is wearing his new pantsand is not walking terribly well in them.

Angie Dinkley drives by with a bus full of tourists. She is displeased to see the gang investigating, as she too sees the source of income that this monster can generate.

She sends them off to school, but not before asking Velma to wear a shirt with the monsters face on itand to tell anyone who asks that theyre $15.

Daphne suggests that they talk to Dr. Potrillo about the monster. They arrive at his office and ask him about the monster. He tells them its named Que Horrifico. Fred picks up a pan flute, which causes Dr. Portillio to get quite defensive about it. When Scooby-Doo tells him that no one accused him of being the monster, he changes his tone.

He shows them the slide show he gave to his Honors class a few weeks prior. Que Horrifico, by day, is a normal person. However, at sundown he transforms and roams the villages playing his mysterious song, transforming the children into Terropogados (or in English: Spookified). The children then do his evil bidding before he takes them off to his spooky town, or cavetheres a lot of debate about it really.

The gang suspect that Dr. Potrillo may be Que Horrifico. He has the pan flute, has admitted to not sleeping well, and has an accent!

The gang arrives at Dr. Potrillos house that night. They try to sneak up but Shaggys new pants give him away. Dr. Potrillo invites them in, since he too believes he may be Que Horrifico.

They chain him to his recliner and proceed to wait. While they wait, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo turn on the TV and begin watching the strange Broccoli Head show from earlier.

Suddenly, Dr. Potrillo starts screaming that its beginning. After a few moments of raving about being scared, he fartsand we realize it was just gas.

Outside, there is a crash and the sound of pan flutes. The gang rushes outside to see Que Horrifico disappear. A fire has been startedhes getting dangerous. Fred announces that they will set a trap.

The gang drives through the spookified neighborhood, where more small fires are burning.

They pull into a house thats for sale, and Fred announces the plan.

They are going to disguise themselves as a family and wait for Que Horrifico to appear.

They manage to trap Que Horrifico, but he plays the pan flute causing the children to appear and attack the gang.

The gang is persued through the house by the children. Shaggy nearly gets taken away by thembut of course Scooby-Doo saves him.

Shaggy and Scooby-Doo take cover inside a closet.

Velma, Daphne and Fred first get trapped in a bedroom, and Velma is nearly taken out the window.

The three group together and stand back, allowing the kids coming through the window and the door to run into each other.

They escape to the living room, where all seems lost until Fred accidentally turns on the Broccoli Head show.

The kids begin laughing and sit down to watch the show.

Que Horrifico appears and commands the kids to attack, however the kids want to watch the show, and take off their masks and fake teeth.

The gang chase Que Horrifico out into the streets and capture him. Or, is it Her?

Que Horrifico is none other than Mary Anne Gleardon. She had wanted to scare away all the adults so that she could run the town the way she wanted to. After learning about Que Horrifico in Dr. Potrillos class, she went to the elementary schools to recruit the kidswith candy. She would have gotten away with it, if it werent for the committo boys quod puella (Latin for Committed boys and girls).

Sheriff Stone arrests Mary Anne because of all the money the town spent on Que Horrifico merchandise, including dance cds and flyers.

That night at K-Ghoul, Angel Dynamite treats the kids to pizza.

Dr. Potrillo appears and tells them he is here to thank them with a Pan Flute Concert! Shaggy tells Velma she needs to take the pants back because he prefers the baggy pants. She seems sad, but understands.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

None

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

None 

My Thoughts:

This is an episode I really like, and for a couple of reasons.

First, its the end of Velma trying to change Shaggy. Sure , it was only a two episode arc, but it was really annoying. Velma has been my favorite character as an adult, so seeing her reduced to being all about a boyfriend is not ok with me at all. Fortunately, that part is just about over.

That being said, I like it because we are seeing character developments and short arcs being written and carried through. This happens again over the course of the series, but this is really the first instance of it.

I love that the bad guy is a precocious girl. Shes opinionated, funny and not afraid to take chances. She returns in another episode in Season 2, and its a very welcome return.

I also love the return to more actual danger. Sure, Man-Crab was kinda scarybut between the Gator People, the Ghost Rig and now the spookified children, the Gang has actually seen some real action that could have led to their demise.

And in this case, the danger is pretty high. The kids have damaged cars and started firesits almost total anarchy on the streets that Que Horrifico has visited. I actually have to wonder if Mary Anne could have truly controlled the children, if thats what theyve sunk to in just a few days time.

The comedy in the episode was more subtle. The recurring joke of Shaggys rubber band was, for me, a great source of humor. Particularly when Scooby-Doo was getting such a kick out of it as well. And his pants, wellthat kinda sums up my own personal feelings about overly tight pants.

One of the things I like about the series is its continued use of color to create mood, and again, this one uses lots of reds for the outdoor scenes in the climax. Red gives it a sense of danger and intensity. Contrasting it with orange/brown inside the house was a nice touch as well, because it gave a different feel of foreboding.

The next episode is a fun one for fans of the original series, and it also gives us more of the Mystery of Crystal Cove.

Pop-Culture References:

The initial appearance of Que Horrifico is a nod to many horror/slasher films where the evil is first seen under a street lamp by the main character (who typically isnt believed).

The opening scenes are a nod to the urban legend of the Babysitter.

When Shaggy gets pulled into the darkness by the spookified children, its similar to the scene in [REC] and its American remake Quarentine.

The sequence with Shaggy and Scooby hiding in a closet and tying the door closed with a scarf is a reference to Halloween when Laurie Strode does the same thing to escape Michael Myers.

Brief Synopsis:

The gangs latest mystery takes them back under Crystal Cove, when an evil Man Crab kidnaps Daphne.

Bad Guy In a Mask:

Man Crab

Episode Review:

The episode begins with two teens, Brenda and Dylan setting up the volleyball courts for the next days big sand volleyball tournament. Brenda is pretty whiny and ready to leave. Dylan tells her its just a little longer and offers her some water. She complains that it isnt Trickells Tricquida diet moisture.

Suddenly, a gigantic claw appears out of the ground and grabs Brenda. Dylan thinks that Brenda has staged an elaborate prank because she doesnt want to stay any longeror somethingbut after the claw pulls her beneath the sand he gets worried.

Suddenly, the beast jumps out of the ground and surprises Dylan as well.

The next day at the beach, Angel Dynamite is DJ-ing and doing the play-by-play for K-Ghoul. She hollers out an advertisement for Trickells Tricquid, for when Mother Nature doesnt want to look fat.

The Mascot for Trickells Tricquid passes by trying to hoc the different versions available, but Shaggy and Scooby-Doo are more interested in real food.

So they go see good old Skipper Shelton! Velma makes the mistake of asking what happened to his nose. Skipper Shelton launches into the story of how a clam stole his nose. And that he will continue shucking clams until he finds his nosebut in the meanwhile he sells strange ice cream made of clam.

Fred asks Daphne if she wants a clam, and she reminds him of what happened the last timeand its not pretty. Fred also asks Skipper Shelton about the new location of the shack. Skipper Shelton laments that every time the town has an event on the beach, they move his business.

Shaggy has to pass on the ice cream as Velma has talked him into giving up junk food. A rift has started to occur. As the gang leaves Skipper Sheltons Shack, a strange something is observing Scooby-Doo.

At the volleyball tournament, the gang is enjoying a gamealthough the romance is a bitnon-existent.

Velma wants to get closer to Shaggybut Scooby-Doo forces his way between them.

Daphne, at first jealous because Fred is staring at the game, is somewhat pacified/depressed to learn that hes fascinated by the nets and not the girls.

Suddenly, the ground starts to shake violently. The Man Crab appears and starts to wreak havoc! He chases the gang around the bleachers and playing field, before kidnapping one of the volleyball players, and disappearing.

The Sheriff arrives on the scene and the gang implores him to shut down the tournament. However, the owner of Trickells Tricquid, and the sponsor of the event calls shenanigans on it. He says that it could have been a Man Crab or a really ugly and overweight person.

The Sheriff also says his department isnt set up for this sort of thing. They are there to serve and protectbut not from Man Crabs.

The gang, naturally, decides they get to investigate, despite Shaggy imploring them to respect authority for once. And they have their first clue. Skipper Sheltons locker is leaking sandand lots of it. And, given that he wasnt around during the attack and is bitter about his shack being moved, he is a natural first suspect.

Fred decides that they will set a trap for the Man Crab, and Daphne (much to her chagrin) will be the bait! While the gang builds the trap, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo have a rare moemnt of quiet, where Shaggy reflects on how he misses eating crab since he pledged to Velma to eat healthier. Scooby-Doo gives him the side eye as he scrambles to correct himself, stating it was his decision. Fred shows up just in time to show off the trap.

Velma goes to fetch Daphne, who has changed into a bathing suit. Velma takes the opportunity to try and ask Daphne for advice about Shaggybut Daphne, thinking that Velma is hinting about her attraction to Fred, goes a bit insane.

Suddenly, the Man Crab appears and begins to chase Daphne. Meanwhile, Shaggy has abandoned his post to go get some clams, but accidentally triggers the trap. And unfortunately, she is captured.

Fred sort of snaps and begins frantically digging at the sand. Velma shoots Shaggy a look as he sheepishly watches.

The scene shifts to K-Ghoul that night.

Velma is explaining whats happened to Angel Dynamite. Fred is still digging. Shaggy is lamenting that if he hadnt tried to be healthy, Daphne would be ok.

Suddenly, the doorbell rings. Scooby-Doo answers it and discovers a letter from Mr. E.

Inside is a torn newspaper article about a group of (seemingly) three kids who went missing. Angel takes a look at it and quickly writes it off as nothing. Theres also an 8-track tape inside.

Fred attempts to play the 8-track on the record player, much to Angels horror.

On the 8-track is a recording of Mr. E. He tells them that this isnt the first time that a group of teens has gone missing from Crystal Cove. He says this is worth researching.

The gang heads to the library.

They find an article about the creation of Trickells Tricquid, one about Skipper Shelton threatening the town for moving his shack and the rest of Mr. Es artcile. Mr. Es article tells them that the Crystal Cove Caverns run under the beach, which means

time to explore!

Inside the caverns they discover a strange winding staircase

that leads to Daphne and the other missing teens! The manage to rescue the teens when suddenly

the Man Crab appears! And proceeds to chase the gang through the caverns and up to the surface.

Fortunately, they manage to spring Freds trap and capture the Man Crab.

Who is revealed to be Bud Shelton, the actual creator of Trickells Tricquid. He wanted revenge for having his creation stolen, and since lawyers take forever, he chose this way. And he would have gotten away if it werent for those meddling brats probing into his crustacean-themed revenge scheme.

Back at K-Ghoul, Shaggy is pigging out on snack food. Daphne tells Fred its sweet that he was so upset over her disapperance. Velma reveals to Daphne that the locket has a picture of Brad Chiles and Judy Reeves.

Angel watches themand has a suspicious air about her.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

1. The Identity of Brad Chiles and Judy Reeves. These two will play a very important part in Season 2. We dont learn their names, yet, but that doesnt diminish their importance.

2. The Newspaper. This is the first we learn of the towns history with Mystery Solving Teams. Also, this is where the gang adopts their name, Mystery Inc.

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

None 

My Thoughts:

I have to preface this review by making a bit of a confession. Beaches scare the pants off of me. Partially because I cant swim. Partially because of all the episodes of Scooby-Doo I saw as a kid where bad things happen. Im not afraid of being actually attacked by a shark, or a pirate, or a Man Crabbut something about them just makes me uneasy.

That said, there are things I do like about this episode.

Again, Skipper Shelton. God, I love him. From his comments about facial undergarments, to his reaction to the clam storyhe justhes delightful.

I like that theyre continuing to develop the relationships of the kids, however I definitely wish they would move along a little faster. We get it, Velma is a harpie who is trying to make Shaggy into something hes not. Fred is clueless. Lets move on.

I like that were seeing more and more of Crystal Cove. Its a surprisingly big town that seems to have just about everything conceivable.

Something else the show has started is the ability of the bad guys to sort of one-up the last one. The costumes, schemes and contraptions all get more and more elaborate, sometimes defying technology and logic. Similarly, so do Freds traps. I mean, honestly, how long does it take to set some of these things up?

In terms of the overall mystery, were getting closer and closer to it really taking off. Were already learning that theres more to Angel Dynamite than meets the eyeand Mr. E remains as mysterious as ever.

The next episode is actually pretty clever and gets back to a more scarier tone.

Pop-Culture References:

Dylan and Brenda are references to characters of the same name on the 1990s teen soap opera, Beverly Hills 90210. Dylan was played by Luke Perry and Brenda was played by Shannon Doherty.

Older versions of Pebbles and Bam-Bam from The Flintstones can be seen playing Volleyball

Brief Synopsis:

Crystal Cove is being terrorized by a Ghost Rig, how will the gang face off against a machine?

Bad Guy In a Mask:

The Ghost Rig

Episode Review:

A young boy has been pulled over by a traffic cop for speeding. The cop tells the boy to be more careful and starts back towards his motorcycle when suddenly a strange, firey, big rig barrels past.

The cop chases after the Ghost Rig, only to be run off the road.

He watches helplessly as the Ghost Rig vanishes.

We fade in on City Hall, where Fred, Shaggy, Scooby-Doo and Velma are looking for Mayor Dad.

Mayor Dad tells Fred that today is the day he joins in the family business, politics. Fred protests, saying that all the kids these days are into setting traps and solving mysteries, and definitely not politics. Mayor Dad insists that Fred is just being silly and that its important to learn how to make pamphlets (I do agree there) and where to put parking meters (Velma snarks about knowing a good place to put one).

He then tells Fred that he needs his help primiarly with getting re-electedby making 40,000 pamphlets.

Meanwhile, Daphne is at home making ascots for Fred, when her parents summon her downstairs.

They want her to meet Rung Ladderton, heir to the local Ladder Fortunewho is kind of a major jerk face. He smugly gives her a gold ladder pendant and then tells her to call him sometime.

Her parents are over the moon for him, and try to convince her to date him instead of Fred. Daphne says that it feels like cheating, even though theyre just friends.

And then a bizarre exchange between them occurs, where Nan tries to tell Daphne it isnt cheating on a friend so much as trying a new cut of beef. Daphne then says she prefers vegetables.

Back at City Hall, Scooby-Doo is attempting to use the copierand failing badly.

Unfortunately, it covers George Avacados with toner. Avacados is the main competition for Mayor Dad. Avacados thinks he can win, since his father was once Mayor (never mind that Mayor Dad is the incumbent). Mayor Dad reveals, however, that Avacados father was arrested for stealing a priceless diamond from the Crystal Cove Bank.

The gang arrives at The Clam Cabin, to discover there is no doorknob on the door.

Skipper Shelton, the owner of The Clam Cabin, calls out to them from a porthole, telling them he is closed. Someone has stolen his crystal doorknobsjust like the clam stole his nose.

Velma tries to invite Shaggy back to her place, only for Scooby-Doo to reveal that he has had a map of every pizza place in Crystal Cove tattooed on his tonguemuch to Velmas horror.

The gang heads back to town along the coast, discussing the sudden rash of missing doorknobs when suddenly

The Ghost Rig appears! And begins to chase them.

After a close call or two, the gang manage to escape. They call Sheriff Stone, who predictably is excited at the prospect of a new tourist attraction, despite the obvious danger it poses.

As Sheriff Stone is leaving, Fred unearths a clue. Using a low-res phone camera, he discovers that the Ghost Truck left behind tire trackswhich means it isnt a ghost.

Daphnes phone rings and Fred answers it. Its Rung calling to tell Daphne that he will pick her up for dinner the next day. Theyre going to The Bloody Steak.

Daphne attempts to explain to Fred, who is very non-plussed and oblivious. He advises her to try the Vlad the Impaler Cursed Chicken and Rice.

The next day at City Hall, we discover all the door knobs are missing. Avacados says that there wont be a shortage if they elect him. Making him very suspicious to the gangso they decide to set a trap.

While waiting for Avacados to appear so they can spring their trap, they get a call from Angel Dynamite. She tells the gang that the tires that the Ghost Truck left behind were only sold to two people, Avacados and G. Nurdo Treddall. Suddenly, the trap springs

and catches Mayor Dad. Fred attempts to explain that they think Avacados is the Ghost Truck Driver and the Doorknob Bandit. Mayor Dad waves it off, stating that ghosts dont need to drive because they can fly, and even if they did drive, it wouldnt be an 18-wheeler because those require a Class-C license. Avacados casually passes by, and the kids chase after him.

Meanwhile, at The Bloody Steak, Daphne is having a miserable time.

No, really. She is. Rung has stood her up.

On the outskirts of town, the rest of the gang are in hot pursuit of Avacados.however in the fog they lose him

but find a parked Ghost Truck! Velma declares this to be the perfect time to investigate (at least, before they go Code Brown).

Upon inspection, they discover that the Ghost Truck is new, but has been painted and covered with material to make it appear both old and on fire.

Unfortunately, before they can find anything else out, it comes to life and chases them. Again.

They lose it by backing into an encampment and turning off the engine and lights.

Rung finally shows up for his date with Daphne. And proceeds to take her food. And stick her with the bill.

The gang barge in to get Daphne caught up to speedhowever Rung makes his presence known first.

And then he and Fred awkwardly trade ascots.

As Scooby-Doo searches for food, they discover an envelope from Mr. E contianing a CD.

Back in the Mystery Machine, they play the CD. Mr. E. leave them a clue telling them to follow the fogand that Crystal cant open doors like diamonds can.

Velma and Daphne question how trustworthy Mr. E. is, particularly after his last warning. However, they have no other leads to go on, so they decide to follow it.

Arriving at the coast, they discover that the tire tracks lead straight into the mountain

inside of which are all the doorknobs!

Daphne discovers a journal left by Theodore Avacados, the father of George. In it, he confesses to the crime. Velma puts two and two together and realizes that Theodore hid the diamond somewhere in Crystal Coveas a doorknob.

Naturally, the Ghost Truck arrives and the final showdown begins.

Eventually, they get the Ghost Truck to persue them into City Hall, where Fred re-springs his trap.

Mayor Dad arrives on the scene complaining about the noise. The gang explains and are about to unmask the bad guy when

Rung Ladderton falls out of the truck. He had been the one searching for the diamondand would have gotten away with it, were it not for his meddling peers.

Daphne reclaims Freds orange ascot.

Mayor Dad thanks Fred for helping solve this mystery, since it will help his campaign as Mayor. He throws a press conference congratulating Fred on returning the diamond, which will make up for the lost revenue of not having a real Ghost Truck.

He also makes a new office, the Office of Pizza Affairs, and names Scooby-Doo its head.

Relevant Clues to the Curse of Crystal Cove:

None in this episode

Mayor Dads Strange Statements:

Screaming Pandas

Pickled Porcupines

My Thoughts:

This is the first episode weve had that didnt really involve the Curse of Crystal Cove. We do later learn what happened to the diamond thats missing, but it doesnt play into the mystery.

However, there are several things this episode *does* accomplish in the grand scheme of things:

The foremost thing is that it sets up Mr. E to be a good guy. Hes been kind of an ominous creep, so the fact he genuinely helps them with no ill intent helps his character a lot. It shows the gang that they can trust him.

It also gives us a look into Daphne. She isnt quite as two-dimensional as she was in the classic series. Here shes set up to be a misfit from her family (solves mysteries and wants Fred) as well as the gang (quite well off financially). We actually get some very solid character development from her as she tries to navigate her way.

In terms of bad guys, this is perhaps the strangest of all the bad guys the gang has ever chased. Its a gigantic truck. The danger is once again very real (again, gigantic truck), and the stakes are higher.

The use of the movie Duel is a pretty brilliant move. The series isnt afraid to pull out obscure references (Episode 9 gets *really* obscure) to mix in with the more obvious references. However, unlike other shows where the joke or moment is lost, with SD: MI, you can still totally enjoy the episode, even if the reference is lost on you.

Again, I have to take a moment to comment on the animation style. Youll notice that when we change locations, I frequently screencap the establishing shot. Part of it is because it makes a nice transition, but part of it is to show off the amazing artwork in the series. The use of definite color palates for areas is really fantastic, and they know how to use the texturing to establish mood.

Also, I love Skipper Shelton. From his nose-patch, to his weird ramblings, I think hes hysterical. Really, most of the denizens of Crystal Cove arebut Skipper Shelton just amuses me the most.

With our next episode we get a little more insight into the Mystery of Crystal Cove!

Pop-Culture References:

As Daphne is tying Freds ascot, she hums the theme song to the original series.

The entire episode, particularly the final sequence, is an homage to the 1971 Steven Spielberg film Duel.

George Avacados insistence that his name is pronounced Uh-vaw-cuh-dose vs. Ah-vah-cah-dose is a play on Patricia Routledges character Hyacinth Bucket on Keeping Up Apperances. (Bouqet vs Bucket).
